intro: Anthephora cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anthephora, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Anthephora cuspidata is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience in arid environments.
